Package com.rb.nonbiz.types

Class SplitMultiplier

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Number
com.rb.nonbiz.types.RBNumeric<T>
com.rb.nonbiz.types.PreciseValue<SplitMultiplier>
com.rb.nonbiz.types.SplitMultiplier
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SplitMultiplier>
public class SplitMultiplier
extends PreciseValue<SplitMultiplier>
A class to hold a stock split ratio, as well as the numerator and denominator of the split.

E.g. for a "3 for 2" split, store the ratio 1.5 as well as the numerator (3) and the denominator (2).

This would be used in calculating stock splits and stock dividends (but not CASH dividends).

Some terminology: a 2:1 split is called a "forward split"; every 1 old share will be replaced by 2 new shares.

Conversely, a 1:2 split is called a "reverse split"; 2 old shares will be replaced by 1 new share. Most splits are "forward splits".

Note that both the numerator and denominator are stored as BigDecimals, so we can represent non-integer splits, e.g. "2.75:1"

See Also:
